prompt: Procedure codes 31645 (Therapeutic Aspiration) and 31624 (BAL). Dx J18.9. Patient 81 F. Findings: Mucus and mucus plugs in Left Mainstem and Left Upper Lobe. Lavage site: Apico-posterior Segment (LB1+2) and Anterior Segment (LB3). Specimen: AFB, Fungal, and Routine Culture.
completion:
NOTE_ID: note_051
SOURCE_FILE: note_051.txt

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date]

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 81-year-old female who presents with persistent atelectasis.

CONSENT The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient indicated a wish to proceed with surgery and informed consent was signed.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J18.9 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J18.9 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration tracheobronchial tree, initial episode (31645)

Bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624) 

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings: Mucus and mucus plugs were identified in the Left Mainstem and Left Upper Lobe.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Left Mainstem and Left Upper Lobe from mucus and mucus plugs.

Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL) Bronchial alveolar lavage was performed at the Apico-posterior Segment (LB1+2) and Anterior Segment (LB3).

Instilled 120 cc of NS, suction returned with 50 cc of NS.

Samples sent for AFB, Fungal, and Routine Culture.

The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)

LUL BAL (AFB, Fungal, and Routine Culture) 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

[REDACTED] is a 81-year-old female who presents for bronchoscopy for persistent atelectasis.

Therapeutic aspiration performed for mucus plugging.

LUL BAL performed for microbiology.

Follow up in clinic.

prompt: Write an op note for a 72yo M. Indication: mucus plugging on CT. Found mucoid impaction in LUL. Did therapeutic aspiration and BAL of LUL. Instilled 100cc/returned 40cc. Sent for AFB, Fungal, and Routine Culture.

prompt: Please generate a bronchoscopy report. The patient is a 34-year-old male with persistent atelectasis. Under general anesthesia, we found mucoid impaction in the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Right Lower Lobe. We suctioned the airways and performed a BAL of the Superior Segment (RB6) and Posterior Basal Segment (RB10). We used 100 cc of saline and got back 40 cc. Specimens sent for Routine Culture and Gram Stain.

NOTE_ID: note_051
SOURCE_FILE: note_051.txt

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT

DATE OF PROCEDURE: [Date]

INDICATION FOR OPERATION [REDACTED] is a 55-year-old female who presents with mucus plugging on CT.

CONSENT The nature, purpose, risks, benefits, and alternatives to Bronchoscopy were discussed with the patient in detail.
The patient indicated a wish to proceed with surgery and informed consent was signed.

PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J18.9 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS

J18.9 Other diseases of bronchus, not elsewhere classified 

PROCEDURE

Therapeutic aspiration tracheobronchial tree, initial episode (31645)

Bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) (31624) 

ANESTHESIA General Anesthesia 

ESTIMATED BLOOD LOSS None 

COMPLICATIONS None 

PROCEDURE IN DETAIL After the successful induction of anesthesia, a timeout was performed (confirming the patient's name, procedure type, and procedure location).

Initial Airway Inspection Findings: Thick, copious secretions were identified in the Left Mainstem and Lingular Bronchus.

Therapeutic Aspiration Successful therapeutic aspiration was performed to clean out the Left Mainstem and Lingular Bronchus from thick, copious secretions.

Bronchoalveolar Lavage (BAL) Bronchial alveolar lavage was performed at the Superior Lingular Segment (LB4) and Inferior Lingular Segment (LB5).

Instilled 120 cc of NS, suction returned with 50 cc of NS.

Samples sent for AFB, Fungal, and Routine Culture.

The patient tolerated the procedure well. There were no immediate complications.

At the conclusion of the operation, the patient was extubated in the operating room and transported to the recovery room in stable condition.

SPECIMEN(S)

Lingula BAL (AFB, Fungal, and Routine Culture) 

IMPRESSION / PLAN

[REDACTED] is a 55-year-old female who presents for bronchoscopy for mucus plugging on CT.

Therapeutic aspiration performed for mucus plugging.

Lingula BAL performed for microbiology.

Follow up in clinic.
